education_needed: Requires BS and 8-12 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 6-10 years of prior relevant experience
description_summary: Maximus is looking for an experienced Senior Enterprise Systems Engineer. Job-Specific Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Establish integration testing process and methodology. Support and recommendations for requirements management process. Provide assessments of policies, plans, and requirements and recommend appropriate responses to address any issues surfaced to ensure comprehensive planning across communities of interest. Assist government clients with developing programmatic goals and objectives, schedules, and reports to high-level government managers. Review and assess implementation plans to identify issues early in the plans.

Maximus is seeking a skilled IaC/DevOps (Infrastructure-as-Code) Lead to support vital systems in the defense of our Homeland. In this role you will focus on enhancing efficiency by implementing cutting-edge deployment pipelines and fostering collaboration between technical teams and enterprise stakeholders. With a strong background in IT service management and a passion for driving continuous improvement, you’ll play a key role in advancing our delivery processes while aligning them with organizational goals and industry best practices.

Maximus is seeking an experienced Database Engineer to join our team! The Database Engineer will provide subject matter proficiency for work described in the task. Responsible for providing analytical skills to support process improvement, specialized studies, and definition of requirements. Typical duties include analysis, planning, developing requirements documents, building functional models, developing procedures, developing functional architectures, and other related management and technical duties. Requires expertise in specialty area. At least 10 years of overall experience in the functional area.

Maximus is seeking an experienced Senior Program Manager to join our team! The Senior Program Manager will be responsible for the development and implementation of assigned projects. Provides day-to-day technical/professional guidance and leadership as appropriate to the area of expertise. Drives technical vision of systems as provided by the PMO and has oversight into and understanding of technical system capabilities and specifications.

Maximus is seeking an experienced Technical Adviser to join our team! The Technical Adviser will be responsible for the development and implementation of assigned projects. Incorporates day-to-day technical guidance and leadership while serving as primary touchpoint to the PMO in regard to the technical development and decomposition of requirements. The role includes leading technical analysis, conducting and documenting systems tests along with developing procedures, functional architectures, and other related management and technical duties. This position is remote, with a preference for candidates capable of commuting to San Antonio, TX OR Ft Meade, MD as needed.

Maximus is seeking an experienced Technical Trainer to provide subject matter proficiency for work in the task. Responsible for providing analytical skills to support process improvement, specialized studies, and the definition of requirements. Duties include designing, planning, organizing, and directing training programs to enable PMO-directed instructors to present training materials, instructional materials, and informational presentations. Requires expertise in a specialty area. This position is contingent upon award.

Provides subject matter proficiency for work described in the task. Responsible for providing analytical skills to support process improvement, specialized studies, and definition of requirements. Typical duties include analysis, planning, developing requirements documents, building functional models, developing procedures, developing functional architectures, and other related management and technical duties. Requires expertise in specialty areas. Front End Software Developer Shall perform engineering tasks for front-end design and development efforts including, but not limited to, creating technical design drawings, mockups, wireframes, and other associated documentation for PMO and stakeholder review, planning and implementing modifications to Graphic Use Interfaces (GUIs), constructing and optimizing various UI elements, optimizing system navigation practices and elements, and facilitating operator ease of use for user-facing feature development.

Provides subject matter proficiency for work described in the task. Responsible for analytical skills to support process improvement, specialized studies, and the definition of requirements. Requires expertise in specialty areas. Back-End Software Developer shall perform engineering tasks for back-end design and development efforts including, but not limited to, developing back-end architectures to support current and new system capabilities and integrations, RESTful API development and modification, database management, and data model development and optimization.

job_title: Sr Counsel - AI and Emerging Technology
education_needed: Juris Doctor (JD) from an accredited law school and admission to one or more State Bars
description_summary: The ideal candidate will have demonstrated expertise in negotiating complex technology agreements end-to-end. They will serve as a cross-functional leader defining technology & AI governance principles and implementing scalable processes for data governance, cybersecurity controls, privacy, consumer protection, trust & safety, and IP management. The role includes responsibilities such as monitor and communicate global legislative trends and best practices in technology, cybersecurity, data-privacy, and AI/ML governance, providing timely advice on legal, regulatory, and governance questions for software, cloud, cybersecurity, and AI/ML solutions.

Maximus is seeking a Network Administrator to provide expertise to a federal client in support of their mission-critical systems in defense of our Homeland. Your role will involve overseeing network administration, troubleshooting complex issues, and ensuring the performance, availability, and security of our network systems. This position is an on-site role, 5 days a week, and requires a secret clearance.

education_needed: B.S. degree in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field

You will collaborate with IT Enterprise Architects and other stakeholders to model an IT enterprise architecture using industry best practices.

The CSR will provide customer service for basic and routine inquiries and problems via multiple possible channels. Calls are basic and routine. Uses computerized system for tracking, information gathering, and/or troubleshooting.

education_needed: BS/MS or similar education in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or equivalent technical experience
description_summary: Maximus Federal delivers mission-critical technology at scale for federal health, civilian and defense customers. As our Technical Business Development Lead, you will drive technology forward capture of high-value federal opportunities. Your duties include scoping and sizing cutting-edge solutions, designing architectures with expert teams and partnering with mission owners to align on Mission Threads and CTO Accelerators.

As part of the Rapid Deployment Team (RDT), you will: Embed seamlessly with federal programs, capturing mission-critical workflows through hands-on-keyboard engineering to design, prototype, and deploy real-time solutions. Transform internal technical innovations into externally consumable solutions, building a repeatable solutions framework to support listings in digital marketplaces. Architect scalable automation with AI and modern tooling, driving CI/CD, infrastructure-as-code, and real-time observability to increase velocity and delivery consistency at mission scale. This role is for senior to principal engineers.

We’re looking for a hands-on, detail-savvy Facilities Specialist to keep our Chester, VA office running smoothly. This position is based in Chester, VA, and also supports other sites around the area, including the Tysons headquarters, on a limited basis as needed, based on manager decision.

Maximus is currently seeking an experienced Lead Solutions Architect with demonstrated success designing and developing solutions for complex applications issues, system administration issues, or network concerns. We are looking for a Lead Architect with proven success leading systems management and integration functions for cloud-based applications and infrastructures. The Lead Architect will play a critical role in defining and implementing technology solutions that align with our business objectives. This role requires an understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Product Development Lifecycle (PDLC), and Agile Development methodologies. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of designing and delivering complex software systems, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. This is a remote position.

At Maximus, we’re proud to be celebrating our 50th year in business. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DB2 DBA to oversee database administration, performance tuning, troubleshooting, and ensuring the availability, integrity, and security of our DB2 databases. This position is on-site, five days a week and candidates must be eligible to obtain a secret security clearance. You will collaborate with development teams to optimize SQL queries, database code, and stored procedures for improved performance. Your role also includes staying updated on emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in DB2 database administration.

Key responsibilities include monitoring system performance, maintaining security protocols, and documenting processes to uphold high availability and compliance standards. This position is on-site five days a week and requires the candidate to be eligible to obtain a Secret clearance.

job_title: Customer Service Representative, Bilingual Spanish - Temporary (Remote)
description_summary: Maximus is seeking Remote Bilingual Spanish Customer Service Representatives for Virginia Medicaid, SNAP, and TANF Eligibility Assistance. We are seeking dedicated and empathetic Remote Bilingual Spanish Customer Service Representatives to assist Virginia residents in navigating the Medicaid, SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program), and TANF (Temporary Assistance for Needy Families) application processes. In this fully remote role, you will be the first point of contact, helping individuals understand and determine their eligibility for these vital social services. If you are passionate about helping others, have strong computer skills and are ready to make a meaningful impact, we encourage you to apply!

This position is on-site, five days a week and requires an active secret clearance.

Maximus is seeking a DevSecOps Engineer to provide expertise to a federal client in support of their mission critical systems in defense of our Homeland. The engineer will ensure that the infrastructure, services, and applications developed meet all standards including security, monitoring, performance, and SLAs. Furthermore, they will collaborate with development and operations teams to design, implement, and maintain secure and automated infrastructure.

This position is an onsite role, 5 days a week and requires a secret clearance.

The role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams and overseeing technical architecture while delivering scalable and reliable solutions. This position is an onsite role, 5 days a week and requires a secret clearance. The position is based in Colorado Springs, CO.

job_title: Technical Program Manager - Skillbridge (Transitioning Military) Program
education_needed: Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s program
description_summary: Maximus is offering an opportunity for transitioning military personnel to develop into a Technical Program Manager within our Defense team through the Department of Defense SkillBridge Program. This 4–6-month training will provide the intern with comprehensive exposure to program management, technical training in cloud, cybersecurity, and digital modernization, as well as an insight into business functions critical to program success. This role is designed to cultivate the skills and experience necessary for a full-time Technical Program Manager role upon successful completion.

This role will provide architectural and facility engineering expertise in researching and reviewing the design, development, construction, alteration, or repair of diplomatic buildings and/or structures to ensure appropriate security of the construction project. This position is on-site and requires an active TS/SCI with Poly clearance. Key responsibilities include review of project plans and construction Security Plans, providing advice to federal leadership on security deficiencies, and developing innovative solutions. Required experience includes reviewing project plans and technical data to determine compliance with applicable laws and regulations, a deep understanding of USG facilities construction, and the ability to interpret blueprints and design documents for large, complex facilities.

You will be responsible for the deployment and maintenance of several platforms supporting multiple applications. The role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams and overseeing technical architecture while delivering scalable and reliable solutions. This is an on-site position that requires a Secret Clearance.

This position requires a Top Secret with SCI Security Clearance. Work will be performed at all three campuses. Minimum Education Requirement: BA degree and 12 – 15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 – 13 years of prior relevant experience.

You will also be responsible for supervising other OSC operators, and act as both mentors and a direct line of escalation. This is an on-site position that requires a Secret Clearance.

Key duties include monitoring system performance, maintaining security protocols, and documenting processes to uphold high availability and compliance standards.

Maximus is seeking a Senior Principal Architect to lead the technical strategy and digital roadmap for a federal government agency. This pivotal role involves setting the direction for architecture, governance, and solution design while aligning with the organization enterprise architecture. The ideal candidate will be adept at defining and implementing architectural principles, making strategic technology recommendations, fostering new technology adoption, and building trust with key business stakeholders. You will work closely with senior management to communicate the requirements needed to advance architectural and digital goals.

We are seeking a Budget Analyst to support the Stormbreaker program of our National Security division. The Budget Analyst assumes a pivotal role, playing a critical and multifaceted part in bolstering the Intelligence Planning, Programming, Budget, and Execution Process (IPPBE). In this dynamic position, the candidate will be responsible for an array of essential tasks aimed at ensuring the financial health and strategic alignment of a directorate/component/office's financial resources. A key aspect of the role involves spearheading the development, execution, and meticulous monitoring of budgets tailored to meet both internal and external requirements. The role also involves budget program execution, ensuring alignment with available resources and programmatic goals.
